definitions.definition: The right to have something, whether actual or perceived.
Something that one is entitled to.
A legal obligation on a government to make payments to a person, business, or unit of government that meets the criteria set in law, such as social security in the US.

main_definition: The right to have something, whether actual or perceived.
secondary_definitions: Something that one is entitled to.
( politics ) A legal obligation on a government to make payments to a person, business, or unit of government that meets the criteria set in law, such as social security in the US.
